Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streakily (fired reddish) below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline with white centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169). '32' is written on a paper label on the inside and on the outside; '92', apparently deleted, is written on the outside.
The number '92' is written in pencile on the outside of the sherd; on the inside there is a paper label marked '32'.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 381)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1453) (phase 2)
